cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 120 mi SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue north-northwest tonight, turn north then north-northeast, making landfall along the central-northern North Carolina coast early Saturday and then track inland across eastern NC, SE Virginia, and the Delmarva Peninsula.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to northern North Carolina coast (near Surf City-Ocracoke Inlet)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Bogue Inlet NC and portions of Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds under Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Bogue Inlet NC to Chincoteague VA, Chesapeake Bay south of Colonial Beach VA; Tropical Storm Warning Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE, Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds, lower Chesapeake & lower Potomac
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern North Carolina, southeastern Virginia, Delmarva Peninsula, and adjoining mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds 20–30 mph possible in squalls; tropical-storm-force winds unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge around 1 ft or less possible; significant inundation not expected at Savannah.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain Friday night into early Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip-currents along Georgia beaches.
